types_of_data_collected: Identity and Contact Data (name, email address, phone number, indirect identifiers)
methods_of_collection: Directly from users during account sign-up or when requesting information
data_usage: To create and administer accounts, communicate with users, provide and maintain services, prevent fraud and abuse, enforce terms of service
third_party_disclosure: Affiliates and corporate partners, service providers and business partners, disclosed during corporate events (mergers, acquisitions), disclosed to regulatory authorities as required by law, disclosed with user consent
retention_period: As long as reasonably necessary for purposes outlined in policy (specific duration not specified)

methods_of_collection: Directly from users when purchasing products or services
data_usage: To facilitate payments for products and services
third_party_disclosure: Service providers and business partners, disclosed to regulatory authorities as required by law
retention_period: As long as reasonably necessary for purposes outlined in policy (specific duration not specified)

types_of_data_collected: Inputs and Outputs (prompts, chat interactions, coding sessions, responses, actions, personal data included in prompts)
methods_of_collection: Directly from users through interactions with services, including third-party application integrations
data_usage: To provide and maintain services, train models and improve services (unless user opts out), safety review for harmful content detection, policy enforcement, AI safety research
third_party_disclosure: Service providers and business partners, affiliates and corporate partners, disclosed to regulatory authorities as required by law, disclosed with user consent
retention_period: As long as reasonably necessary for purposes outlined in policy; disassociated from user ID when used for training (except when flagged for safety review)

types_of_data_collected: Feedback (ratings, suggestions, improvement ideas, conversation data associated with ratings)
methods_of_collection: Directly from users when they provide feedback, rate outputs, or use thumbs up/down icons
data_usage: To improve services, train and improve models
third_party_disclosure: Service providers and business partners, affiliates and corporate partners
retention_period: Disassociated from user ID when used for training; entire related conversation stored as part of feedback

types_of_data_collected: Communication Information (name, contact information, message contents)
methods_of_collection: Directly from users when they communicate with Anthropic, including via chatbot on Help site
data_usage: To communicate with users, resolve disputes, provide support
retention_period: As long as reasonably necessary for purposes outlined in policy (specific duration not specified)

types_of_data_collected: Device and Connection Information (device type, operating system, browser information, web page referers, mobile network, connection information, ISP, time zone, IP address, device location, device/advertising identifiers, probabilistic identifiers)
methods_of_collection: Automatically from user's device or browser when accessing or using services
data_usage: To provide and maintain services, improve services, conduct research, debug and repair errors, analyze service usage, ensure security
third_party_disclosure: Service providers and business partners, affiliates and corporate partners, disclosed to regulatory authorities as required by law
retention_period: As long as reasonably necessary for purposes outlined in policy (specific duration not specified)

types_of_data_collected: Usage Information (dates and times of access, browsing history, search queries, links clicked, pages viewed, device technology information)
methods_of_collection: Automatically collected during use of services
data_usage: To provide and maintain services, improve services and conduct research, analyze effectiveness of services, study user behavior, analyze general user behavior (in aggregated form)
third_party_disclosure: Service providers and business partners, affiliates and corporate partners
retention_period: As long as reasonably necessary for purposes outlined in policy; may be aggregated or de-identified for analysis (specific duration not specified)

types_of_data_collected: Log and Troubleshooting Information (log files, error information, error timing, feature being used, application state, communications or content at time of error)
methods_of_collection: Automatically collected when services are performing or when errors occur
data_usage: To debug and identify and repair errors, investigate and resolve security issues, improve services
retention_period: As long as reasonably necessary for purposes outlined in policy (specific duration not specified)

methods_of_collection: Automatically through cookies, scripts, or similar technologies used by Anthropic and service providers
data_usage: To recognize users, customize or personalize experience, market additional products or services, analyze use of services for safety and utility, manage services
third_party_disclosure: Service providers (as detailed in Cookie Policy)
retention_period: As specified in Cookie Policy (not specified in this document)

types_of_data_collected: Training Data for Models (publicly available information, third-party commercial datasets, user/crowd worker provided data, feedback, materials flagged for safety review, internally generated data)
methods_of_collection: From publicly available internet sources, through commercial agreements with third parties, from users and crowd workers (including Inputs and Outputs unless opted out), from explicit user feedback, from flagged materials, generated internally
data_usage: To train and improve AI models, conduct research, advance AI safety research
third_party_disclosure: Not specified (subject to Non-User Privacy Policy)
retention_period: Not specified in this document (see Non-User Privacy Policy)

types_of_data_collected: Materials Flagged for Safety, Security, or Policy Review
methods_of_collection: Automatically flagged by systems or explicitly reported by users through feedback mechanisms
data_usage: To train trust and safety classification and generative models, improve harmful content detection, enforce policies, advance AI safety research, re-identified to enforce Usage Policy with responsible user if necessary
third_party_disclosure: Service providers and business partners, disclosed to regulatory authorities as required by law
retention_period: Disassociated from user ID for training purposes; may be re-identified for policy enforcement

methods_of_collection: Processed from collected personal data through aggregation or de-identification
data_usage: To analyze effectiveness of services, conduct research, study user behavior, train AI models, improve user experience
third_party_disclosure: Not specified (no longer considered personal data after de-identification)
